pullRequest.body:
These have very general keys but narrow application. We scope them to their namespaces.

In particular, the `no_index`ed `ofNat` simp theorems are now explicitly opted into. If the handling of `ofNat` changes in core, this makes it easy to update.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [70ddb47265](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15620/commits/70ddb47265a796daaaa0a32599f20e4303ecd78a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CharZero.eq_neg_self_iff`
`+ CharZero.neg_eq_self_iff`
`- eq_neg_self_iff`
`- neg_eq_self_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/c535d7a7-2c9f-4d9d-afa2-b23ef2a17e69) for commit 754a2040263dd3a4978471f27cafcbbb63b33b81.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/085156a8-725b-499f-b0b5-4b868c90fc3b/to/c535d7a7-2c9f-4d9d-afa2-b23ef2a17e69) against commit 2edef7d509a7aeba89793a84905121a9f19171b6.

> Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/c535d7a7-2c9f-4d9d-afa2-b23ef2a17e69) for commit [754a204](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/754a2040263dd3a4978471f27cafcbbb63b33b81). There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/085156a8-725b-499f-b0b5-4b868c90fc3b/to/c535d7a7-2c9f-4d9d-afa2-b23ef2a17e69) against commit [2edef7d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/2edef7d509a7aeba89793a84905121a9f19171b6).

Dropped total instructions by 200B and linting instructions by 100B/1%

While I like the idea of this, I feel like it's going to be hard to remember, and annoying to need to explicitly open this scope. What I suspect is likely is that people are going to expect a `simp` lemma to be capable of handling something, it will fail, and they'll have no idea why.

It was necessary to `open scoped ofNat in` many places.

Let me split the CharTwo/CharZero scoping and the OfNat issues. 

There is some hope that the core issues with handling of OfNat will be resolved at some point. I will say more on the split.
#15631 does everything but the `OfNat` simp theorems and should be straightforward

#15631 and #15676 achieve most of the performance gains with no downsides. 

Closing this

pullRequest.title: perf(Algebra.CharTwo/Zero): scope lemmas
